image.altText: A woman with cropped hair, wearing glasses and a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: Three decades after the landmark Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody, the Northern Territory parliament rejects a motion proposing the federal government establish an independent oversight body.

title.children: Motion calling for federal oversight of NT deaths in custody rejected

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Santos's Darwin gas plant is set for a new lease of life despite a major methane leak. The company told federal officials the risk it could be forced to meet best practice on carbon emissions was "intolerable".

title.children: Prospect of net zero an 'intolerable risk' for leaking Santos plant

image.altText: A man in a button-up shirt and tie walking out of a courthouse.

props.synopsis: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris has been found guilty of physically assaulting four students, including choking a pupil and dragging students by the ear.

title.children: Former principal guilty on four counts of physically assaulting students

image.altText: A woman holds bills in front of her and looks stern

props.synopsis: Kerrie Matthews has been forced to sell personal items to afford life-saving diabetes equipment, and with skyrocketing bills she is putting her house on the market and leaving the Northern Territory.

title.children: $5 milk and $90 rent rises: NT cost of living pushing families into housing stress

image.altText: A young boy in a sporting team singlet plays by a river

props.synopsis: A witness at an inquest into the death of Alice Springs boy Mitchell Thomas has denied doctoring an electrical report in the wake of a fatal house fire.

title.children: Electrician denies 'witness contamination' in child house fire inquest

image.altText: A man smiles into the camera. A game demo can be seen on his computer in the background.

props.synopsis: Better known for its gas and iron ore, the Pilbara hopes to add gaming to its list of local exports as internet access and technology improve.

title.children: Regional developers cash in on the global gaming industry

image.altText: Minister for Indigenous Australians Malarndirri McCarthy stands at a lecturn during a press conference.

props.synopsis: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

title.children: 'Demands our country's full attention': Funding threat on Closing the Gap

image.altText: Two people on a beach with a large mass of fishing nets in front of them.

props.synopsis: Illegal fishing is ravaging the world's oceans of fish and shellfish but it is what is left behind that is creating a mess for governments worldwide and of Australia's most remote beaches.

title.children: The ocean's least natural predator has come for Australia

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has doubled down on its stance against detaining transgender women in female prisons, as a local LGBTQIA+ group says it is "horrified" by the comments.

title.children: Advocates condemn NT leader's comments on trans women in female prisons

image.altText: Eastwood Police station

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a number of families attended Eastwood Police Station on Wednesday evening after growing frustrated that a local high school had failed to act on a complaint.

title.children: Police investigating reports explicit deepfakes made of Sydney schoolgirls

image.altText: A man standing next to the Balibo Five sign.

props.synopsis: On the 50th anniversary of the Balibo Five murders, families are still grieving the loss of their loved ones and remain committed to holding those responsible accountable for their actions.

title.children: 'It still hurts': Families seek justice 50 years since the Balibo Five murders

image.altText: Soldiers in jumpsuits stand in formation on tarmac in front of a large reconnaisance plane.

props.synopsis: Australia's most sophisticated military surveillance plane was deployed 45 times next to Ukraine in the last three months as part of NATO efforts to monitor Russian activity.

title.children: Australian spy plane deployed 45 times during mission to help Ukraine

image.altText: Man stands next to Chinese flag at a podium

props.synopsis: Trump may have expressed "shock", but his administration is clearly not surprised at China's willingness to flex its dominance on rare earths.

title.children: Beijing's latest move shocked Trump but Australia sees an opportunity

image.altText: People on the streets of Singapore

props.synopsis: Businesses in Singapore — one of the most trade-exposed economies in the world — have been watching the fallout from Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs with apprehension.

title.children: Singapore was hit with a 10pc US tariff but the fallout reaches further

image.altText: A Localcoin branded Bitcoin ATM.

props.synopsis: New powers will be created to crack down on the use of crypto ATMs amid a warning from the government that they're being used for scams and money laundering. Follow live.

title.children: Government announces new powers to crack down on crypto ATMs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Surprise spike in Australia's unemployment rate to 4.5 per cent
Hanson flags 'high profile' defection from Liberals to One Nation
New shadow A-G under pressure while pressed on Coalition's plan for youth crime

image.altText: an Australian flag pictured on the uniform of Australian Army personnel.

props.synopsis: Paramedics were called to the single-vehicle rollover near the army's Townsville Field Training Area, west of the city, on Wednesday night.

title.children: Rollover involving ADF personnel leaves one with life-threatening injuries

image.altText: A woman in a blue shirt and jeans standing at the trunk of a big tree in a green rainforest.

props.synopsis: Climate change is killing trees faster than they can be replaced leading to greater carbon emissions, according to a new study.

title.children: Australia's tropical trees emit more carbon than they absorb: study

image.altText: A model of a rock shelter, with a small model person placed adjacent for scale

props.synopsis: A full-scale replica of the Juukan Gorge rock shelter, destroyed by mining company Rio Tinto, will be built over the remains of the original in Western Australia's north.

title.children: Inside the plan to rebuild Juukan Gorge rock shelter destroyed by Rio Tinto

image.altText: A man carries a box through a car park near a large building. Men and woman walk in a loose procession behind him.

props.synopsis: Journalists working at the Pentagon had been asked to sign a pledge to refrain from reporting information not authorised for release by the US Department of War.

title.children: Journalists turn in press passes, exit Pentagon over new reporting rules

image.altText: GettyImages-2205357933

props.synopsis: It was one of the more chaotic AFL trade periods on record as picks and players moved all over the place — but who came out ahead the most?

title.children: Which team 'won' the AFL trade period — and does free agency need a fix?

image.altText: Half of a white metal hull with debris around it lies on the ocean floor, with blue water and harsh light

props.synopsis: A report has found the owner failed to adequately test the Titan submersible and was unaware of its true durability before it imploded in 2023, killing five people.

title.children: Faulty engineering triggered implosion of submersible headed to Titanic wreckage

image.altText: a tarmac worker helps guide a poseidon plane

props.synopsis: The federal government has re-established the Number 12 Squadron in SA at the same time as Australia's anti-submarine capability is expanding with the arrival of new aircraft.

title.children: Historic squadron rebooted ahead of Albanese-Trump meeting

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: New polling shows most Australians want to stick with the US alliance, despite holding overwhelmingly negative views towards the Trump administration and harbouring deep worries about the erosion of American democracy.

title.children: Aussies stick with US in new poll despite disliking Trump

image.altText: Nathan studying at a desk, with papers and a laptop. He is wearing a red shirt.

props.synopsis: Sitting year 12 exams is a big achievement for anyone, but more so for Nathan Barbara having undergone a heart transplant less than a year ago.

title.children: Sydney student's feat ahead of HSC exams after health challenges

image.altText: A young macaque monkey in a cage holds a banana

props.synopsis: Macaque monkeys introduced under German colonial rule have overrun Angaur in Palau. Now in the thousands, the monkeys are causing cultural and environmental upheaval.

title.children: How mines, bombs and US military plans fuel a monkey island takeover

image.altText: A man wears a tan-coloured trench coat and another man wears a white suit and tie in a composite image

props.synopsis: The collapse of the case against the men — a former think-tank director and a researcher for a senior MP — prompts some to argue the British government deliberately failed to provide enough evidence against the pair in order to avoid upsetting China.

title.children: How two words unravelled cases against two suspected Chinese spies

image.altText: An aerial view of dry, arid ground with dirt tracks where four-year-old Gus went missing

props.synopsis: More than 100 people, including from SA Police, the Australian Defence Force, and the State Emergency Services, have been walking about 20 kilometres per day in hot conditions during the renewed search, police say.

title.children: Search for Gus resumes in hot, windy conditions

image.altText: A man wearing a red t-shirt, with shoulder-length, straight brown hair, looks straight ahead.

props.synopsis: Almost four years after his leg was partially severed in a workplace accident, Dean Spencer's recovery is ongoing.

title.children: Abattoir worker who lost part of leg in accident recalls how he was blamed

image.altText: Penfolds bottles on a shelf.

props.synopsis: Cheaper bulk wine has been struggling in the market, but now even prestigious labels like Penfolds are feeling the pinch off the back of changing drinking habits and a reported crackdown on lavish banquets for civil servants.

title.children: Australian wine labels feeling the pinch as Chinese buy and drink less

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman wears a dark sleeveless top on a tennis court.

props.synopsis: Australian duo Ajla Tomljanović and James Duckworth reach the quarterfinals at their respective events in China and Kazakhstan.

title.children: Tomljanović, Duckworth continue late-season surge in Asia

image.altText: Smiling girl with I Voted sticker

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Hume Council will see the city's first-ever democratically elected youth mayor take office.

title.children: In Melbourne's north, a council for young people is taking shape

image.altText: A fuzzy texture over peach coloured funnels

props.synopsis: Extreme close-ups of rice weevil, pollen in a spider's web and a geometer moth laying eggs are among this year's Nikon Small World competition entries from thousands of scientists and artists across the globe. Here are the judges' favourites.

title.children: Photomicroscopy competition's top 15 images capture tiniest signs of life

image.altText: A young girl uses a laptop

props.synopsis: Victorian primary school students will spend no more than 90 minutes a day on screens under reforms announced by the Victorian government.

title.children: Victorian schools to limit screen time, provide free laptops

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: Ukraine implements emergency power cuts across the country amid a relentless drone assault on the country's power grid.

title.children: US vows to 'impose costs on Russia' if Ukraine war continues
